meanings.definition: relating to the structure of an organism
meanings.sent1: The anatomical features of the frog help us understand its body structure.
meanings.sent2: Doctors use anatomical knowledge to study the human body.
meanings.sent3: The anatomical puzzle was challenging but fun to solve.
meanings.sent4: Her attention to anatomical details in her drawings made them lifelike.
meanings.sent5: The anatomical diagrams in the textbook made learning about the body easier.

meanings.definition: pertaining to the bodily structure of an organism
meanings.sent1: Anatomical differences between species can be fascinating to explore.
meanings.sent2: The scientist's research focused on the anatomical similarities between primates.
meanings.sent3: The anatomical costume for the play was surprisingly comfortable.
meanings.sent4: His anatomical precision in surgery saved many lives.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting captured the anatomical details of the flower perfectly.

meanings.definition: of or relating to the structure of living organisms
meanings.sent1: Studying anatomical changes in plants helps in understanding their growth.
meanings.sent2: Anatomical studies provide insights into the evolution of species.
meanings.sent3: The anatomical model of the heart was both educational and entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The anatomical complexity of the ecosystem amazed the researchers.
meanings.sent5: Anatomical adaptations in animals showcase the wonders of nature.
